Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; rosette in added white outline with added red centres above band of billets and alternating red and white dots between lines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of seated sphinx (part of neck, hair, wing, top of forelegs and body; with red on hair, wing and legs), to left.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 287, no. 843, pl. 118) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.477d)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1047) (phase 2)
